admreg: Middle East and North Africa,Middle East and North Africa
subsc: Central government administration,Tertiary education,Secondary education,Primary education
trustfund: TF020725-IBRD DEBT SERVICE,TF022221-CANADIAN CTF FOR SUSTAINABLE DEV-GENERAL

abstracts.cdata!:
The ratings for the project were as
            follows: the outcome was satisfactory, the sustainability
            was likely, the institutional development impact was
            substantial, and the Bank and borrower performance were both
            satisfactory. The lessons learned indicate that the United
            Nations Development Programme (UNDP) Grant in the amount of
            US$700,000 was an important element in jump starting the
            necessary activities to launch the project into its
            implementation phase. The project used the existing Ministry
            of Education (MOE) implementing agencies (General Authority
            for Educational Buildings (GAEB), Central Directorate for
            Educational Planning and Information (CDEPI), National
            Center for Examinations and Educational Evaluation (NCEEE),
            etc.) to carry out its activities. The project's use of
            the National Investment Bank (NIB) for construction
            supervision, oversight and review of the GAEB's work
            was a valuable experience, validating the fiduciary aspects
            as well. This project only had a monitoring and assessment
            system only two of its components: the teacher training and
            the institutional development components. It should have
            been designed with a formal monitoring and evaluation
            (M&E) program for all of its components.
